summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing media coverage of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest for sex trafficking of minors. It notes that Epstein's attorney declined to comment, and the sender observes that Epstein's side has little room to spin the arrest positively.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email and the Daily Beast article; arrested for sex trafficking of minors.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who declined to comment to The Daily Beast on the night of Epstein's arrest.

connections.description: Martin Weinberg is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's attorney in the referenced news story.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Arrested for Sex Trafficking
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested for sex trafficking of minors, as reported by The Daily Beast.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested for sex trafficking of minors, as reported on July 6, 2019.
Epstein's attorney, Martin Weinberg, declined to comment to The Daily Beast on the night of the arrest.
The email, sent from within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY, suggests internal monitoring of media coverage and public perception of the case.
The sender opines that Epstein's legal team has little room to positively spin the arrest.
